import pandas as pd 
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np 
import seaborn as sn
from scipy import stats
from statsmodels.regression.linear_model import OLS
import statsmodels.api as sm


# importing the dataset 

df = pd.read_csv("/Users/suchenhuang/Desktop/Poverty Tracker Data No Labels.csv")
df

# Household Income Visulized


household_income_spm = df['spmres_tc']
x_value = household_income_spm

fig, axs = plt.subplots(figsize=(12,8))

axs.hist(x_value, color="lightskyblue", edgecolor="white",
        bins=np.linspace(0.0, 567595.43, 58), label = "")

plt.title("Income Distribution of New York City", fontsize=20)
axs.set_xlabel("Household Income [USD]", fontsize=18)
axs.set_ylabel("Number of people", fontsize=18)
axs.tick_params(labelsize=15)

axs.axvline(np.median(household_income_spm), color='lightskyblue', ls='dashed', lw = 1,
           label = "Median", alpha = 0.9)
axs.axvline(np.mean(household_income_spm), color='grey', ls='dashed', lw = 1,
           label = "Mean")
axs.legend(prop={'size': 15})
plt.text(350000,-80, '* Data Source: Robin Hood Public Use 2015-2018')
plt.show()

# NYC Income Boxplot


fig, axs = plt.subplots(figsize=(12,8))
axs.boxplot(household_income_spm)
plt.title('Household Income NYC', fontsize=20)
axs.set_xticklabels(['Household Income'])
axs.set_ylabel('Income [USD]', fontsize=18)
axs.tick_params(labelsize=15)
plt.show()

# NYC Income Summary Statistics

q1 = np.percentile(household_income_spm, 25, interpolation='midpoint')
q3 = np.percentile(household_income_spm, 75, interpolation='midpoint')
print("Sample Size:", len(household_income_spm))
print("Mean:", np.mean(household_income_spm))
print("Median:", np.median(household_income_spm))
print("IQR:", q3-q1)
print("Maximum:", np.max(household_income_spm))
print("Std:", np.std(household_income_spm))
print("Standard Error is:", np.std(household_income_spm) / np.sqrt(3908)) 
print("95% Mean CI low:", np.mean(household_income_spm) - 2*np.std(household_income_spm) / np.sqrt(3908))
print("95% Mean CI high:", np.mean(household_income_spm) + 2*np.std(household_income_spm) / np.sqrt(3908))
print("95% Median CI low:", np.median(household_income_spm) - 2*np.std(household_income_spm) / np.sqrt(3908))
print("95% Median CI high:", np.median(household_income_spm) + 2*np.std(household_income_spm) / np.sqrt(3908))

# Self-rated health conditions


table = pd.crosstab(index=df['imp_health'], columns= 'count')
table

labels = ['Excellent', 'Very Good', 'Good', 'Fair', 'Poor']
sizes = [664, 1227, 1166, 666, 185]

explode = (0, 0, 0, 0.1, 0.1)
colors = ['lightgrey','lightsteelblue','lavender','lightskyblue', 'dodgerblue']

fig1, ax1 = plt.subplots()
ax1.pie(sizes, explode = explode, labels = labels, colors = colors, autopct ='%1.1f%%',
        shadow = True, startangle = 10)
plt.title('Self-reported Health Conditions of New Yorkers',fontweight = "bold", fontsize = 15, pad = 25)

ax1.axis('equal')
plt.tight_layout()
plt.text(1.2,-1,'* Data Source: Robin Hood Public Use 2015-2018')
plt.show()

# Illness or Disabilities that limit work


table = pd.crosstab(index=df['imp_healthlim'], columns= 'count')
table

labels = ['YES', 'NO']
sizes = [927, 2981]

colors = ['lightskyblue','lightgrey'] 
fig1, ax1 = plt.subplots()
ax1.pie(sizes, colors = colors, labels=labels, autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=0,
       labeldistance= 1.1,  pctdistance=0.8)

centre_circle = plt.Circle((0,0),0.60,fc='white')
fig = plt.gcf()
fig.gca().add_artist(centre_circle)
plt.title('Health Problems / Disabilities that Limit or Affect Working',fontweight="bold", fontsize=15, pad=35)

ax1.axis('equal')  
plt.tight_layout()
plt.text(1.2,-1,'* Data Source: Robin Hood Public Use 2015-2018')
plt.show()

# Deppresive moods


table = pd.crosstab(index=df['qd3'], columns= 'count')
table

labels = ['YES', 'NO', 'NA / Refused']
sizes = [1210, 2666, (28+4)]

colors = ['lightskyblue','lightgrey', 'white'] 
fig1, ax1 = plt.subplots()
ax1.pie(sizes, colors = colors, labels=labels, autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=0,
       labeldistance= 1.1,  pctdistance=0.8)

centre_circle = plt.Circle((0,0),0.60,fc='white')
fig = plt.gcf()
fig.gca().add_artist(centre_circle)
plt.title('New Yorkers Experiencing Depressive Moods',fontweight="bold", fontsize=15, pad=35)
ax1.axis('equal')  
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Anxiety Moods


table = pd.crosstab(index=df['qd4'], columns= 'count')
table

labels = ['YES', 'NO', 'NA / Refused']
sizes = [1276, 2587, (26 + 9 + 3)]

colors = ['lightskyblue','lightgrey', 'white'] 
fig1, ax1 = plt.subplots()
ax1.pie(sizes, colors = colors, labels=labels, autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=0,
       labeldistance= 1.1,  pctdistance=0.8)

centre_circle = plt.Circle((0,0),0.60,fc='white')
fig = plt.gcf()
fig.gca().add_artist(centre_circle)
plt.title('New Yorkers Experiencing Anxiety',fontweight="bold", fontsize=15, pad=35)
plt.text(1.2,-1,'* Data Source: Robin Hood Public Use 2015-2018')
ax1.axis('equal')  
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
